intro: Hasseltia floribunda, commonly known as the Cape rose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking pink or red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific conditions to flourish.
